Love the Texas cheese fries! Love that you can get quite a bit of food for a good price here. And the margaritas are always delicious. Keep up the good work.

This review isn't necessarily for chilis the company. We all know how the food is at this chain restaurant. Decent. Not the best but good for a family dinner to satisfy everyone. But the particular location should be avoided if you value your health and cleanliness. My family came here for dinner. My son had to use the restroom so my dad took him. While my father was waiting for my son to finished he witnessed a cook come in and go to the bathroom then walk out. WITHOUT WASHING HIS HANDS. He was immediately disgusted and spoke to the manager. The manager blew the situation off and was like "oh you must be talking about the Caucasian guy" as if this guy has been a problem already. Please if you wan chilis the one in vista village isn't that much further down the road. And if anyone can direct me to the health department to make a formal complaint please message me.

Pretty good service,  but omg . ..the portions of my wings were so small. Corporate nickel and dime us to death . Check out this tiny portion of my wings.  I'll think twice before I go to another chili's .

Friday afternoon in the bar area wasn't crowded at all. Somewhat rather relaxing. I came here per request of my mother because she was craving their Southwest Chicken Salad. I was in a bit of a different mood, but made the best of it! I decided to order the Shrimp Tacos and since I've eaten at Chilis numerous times, I feel like they lack in the flavor department, so I asked the waitress if by any chance the chef could make a side of mango salsa to go with my tacos! My shrimp tacos weren't too bad, but the mango salsa definitely AMPED up the flavor on them making them one of my favorite foods to eat there! Customer service was also much better than my last experience as my waitress and the chef didn't mind my little extra order!

Came here tonight with my daughters and I would have to     say that this is the worst service we had at chilis. First was margaritas we got the 2 for $35 and we ordered virgin margaritas and they didn't give us the shakers.  They put them in a regular glass and didn't give us the shakers. When confronted about it we were told that chilis changed their glasses. Although we new that wasn't true because we have had a previous visit and the cups were the same. Then our appetizers came and that was fine. Dinner came and I was cutting my daughters steak up and as she ate a long hard white (object) looked like an worm but it didn't move. You couldn't cut it with a knife. When we confronted the waiter Brittany and Shawn (the manager) they stated that it was just fat. The skillet mash potatoes came on a plate and not a skillet. Finally we got dessert, we got the salted caramel molten and instead of putting that salted caramel they put cinnamon and sugar. When I confronted the waiter Brittany she argued that that's how it came. I pointed to the picture and explained that we had it before. She still tried to argue with me and I told her that no that's not how it comes. She then admitted that the chefs didn't prep the salted caramel for the topping. I asked her if she could go  and get the correct topping. We cut into the molten and we found out that the molten wasn't hot enough for the caramel to flow out. We love chilis but this has been the worst service we ever had.

Came with my daughter. We shared the free happy hour chips and salsa and had the enchilada soup. Then the 2 for $20 dinner. As usual, the food was as expected, corporate tasty. I had the Cajun chicken. A bit bland but not bad. Bread was burnt. She had the chicken tenders they were very good.  The bad: We were basically ignored for 20 minutes until I got the bartender to call a server. Poor girl was working both sides of the restaurant. But that's not my problem. We never got a refill on our chips and salsa and had to flag her down for drinks.  Now the gross: I opened the menu and it was wet. And had chunks of food in it. Figured I would get another one. Same thing. Wet with chunks of food. Nasty and really gross.

Sometimes you don't want real Mexican food, you want the American manufactured kind. Man!!! This is exactly what I was craving this afternoon. The quesadilla was buttery and crisp and the beef classic nachos are amazing.  Super glad we chose to come here this afternoon, EXACTLY what I needed.

We have visited Chili's at least once month for the last 2 years or so! My family and I always get excellent service and the food is always great! We never have any complaints!! I am not sure why they don't get better reviews!! I give them 5 stars!! They deserve it! Chili's, thank you for your excellent quality customer service and you delicious food! Will keep visiting as long as we are still in Cali!!! Recommended!!!

It's average. I mean its Chili's. They don't have very many options.. They honestly need more. The bottomless Chips & Salsa are literally the best thing. & the skillet cookie. If you're looking for whatever food with not so many options but want chips and salsa.. come here!
Had lunch at Chili's today. Ordered a flatbread well done. came back not well done. Service was terrible . Tea tasted like water

Service was excellent. Sat at the bar ordered our drinks and food. Came out in a decent amount of time. They have the 2 for $20 deal it includes appetizer and 2 main entrees listed on the menu. Totally worth it. Bartentender Kimmy made an amazing pineapple vodka drink just the way I make it at home. Super strong.  Our go to place if we're in the area.
Food was good - service was quick - efficient - and the atmosphere is family friendly. Great place to stop when you're on a budget and in a rush. Came in hungry - leaving satisfied.

Food was good, but the service wasn't! Waitress was slow and didn't put some of our food in or it just didn't come. Had to wait forever for the dessert to come, thought she had ended her shift and just went home. Finally it came. Food that didn't shop up did on the bill! Really?

The food here is okay, but very salty! Always makes me feel sick afterward, could be because im pregnant but not normally does food ever make me feel this  sick. The last two servers we had were sweet amd friendly but never checked up on our table either time. Servers always seem to need to be flagged down. Other than that, Chilis has been kind of mediocre in my last visits. Hopefully it gets better

As mentioned in prior reviews, this place is a go-to for dinner dates with me and the kids.  We came here last night, and our server was Alexa.  I have had some pretty average service here as of late, and didn't expect tonight to go any different.  I was wrong.   Alexa's style of table service was truly a breath of fresh air.   Courteous: Check. Attentive: Check  Quick and timely: check From the first bite of the meal to the obligatory final offer for dessert, She was beyond impressive.  Some servers are not used to working with kids, and she had that in spades.  Instead of staggering the water with the chocolate milk (my kid is a drink-it-all-now-as-soon-as-I-get-it kid)  She brought he water and milk out at the same time.  in all my years of trying to figure out how to slow this process, the water threw off my daughter.  It was the first time that food service was able to change our dining experience in a positive manner, just by the rhythm of the items coming out.  It sounds stupid.  But it made a big deal when she had chocolate milk left over, and wasn't asking for either another one to be ordered, or some of whatever I was drinking.  Anyways. Then the cheese ball incident.  Somehow, the wings I ordered got the wrong sauce on them.  It happens.  This was remedied immediately, (see what I am saying? Crazy), with the plate returning with the correct items in under 90 seconds.  Damn.  You go girl.  In the kerfuffle of getting new food out, at some point out of my view, a frozen - uncooked, YES - cheeze buddy (cheese bites?) (not sure what they are called),  made its way into one of the dipping sauces.  just under the surface.  This plus wrong sauce, would have been game over.  But Again, IMMEDIATELY offered to remedy.  My reaction:  I ate it, therefore, it was on me.  Nothing left to fix.  She offered to replace, to comp, etc....her on the spot 'let me fix this NOW" was so refreshing.  I remember when service USED to feel like this, and not in just the super fancy, ritzy places.  She is a dying breed of server:  ONE WHO TAKES PRIDE IN HER WORK.   Not sure where to go from here.  I think my bar just got re-set for every day dining service, and I am pretty sure that the rest of them are just waiting out there, ready to remind me she is a needle in a very large, food filled haystack.  Again Great Job, Alexa.   - RTJ

Ok seriously guys, get it together. This is my second time in this location ordering take out. I call in ahead of time both times and both times quote 10 minutes. I wait a good 15 minutes before walking in only to wait an additional 10 minutes minimum each time. This time, I actually wasn't even helped for a while. No one was working the to go counter. A manager finally came over which is cool. But it's not like he was overly nice or sorry for the wait. Both times I've been in here it hasn't been busy. Not even every table was full. I'll call it moderately busy. I'd much rather order macaroni grill and get 10x better service and quicker service than to go to chilis and wait again.  ----super frustrated----- As I am typing this I'm still waiting.

Went here about 2 months ago with my boyfriend, I probably should have written this sooner. It was a Wednesday at about 7 o'clock, not very busy. We walked in and there was no hosts at the door so we just kind of stood there awkwardly for 4 or 5 minutes until someone finally came up and took us to a booth right next to a HUGE party of at least 20 people, it was so loud that I couldn't even hear the hostess tell us the specials. As the hostess walked away I noticed her cell phone sticking halfway out of her back pocket, which I find extremely unprofessional. The server came up, seemed a little uncomfortable, not sure if she was a new server or what, anyway she got our drink orders and our food orders. I got chicken strips and my boyfriend got pasta. My chicken was cold and tasted almost doughy and mushy. My boyfriend, however, really liked his pasta. My server refilled my Dr. Pepper and when she set it down, the cup was soaking wet, hot, and my drink had no ice in it, so my Dr. Pepper was warm. I ended up not eating my food or touching my drink again. My boyfriend enjoyed his meal though, that's the only reason I gave more than one star. And then just as an added bonus, as we were walking out, the hostess that sat us was standing at the front playing on her phone while she was supposed to be working, I told her to have a nice night and she looked startled because she hadn't noticed us walk up and she said "yeah you too".

My husband and I go here often for happy hour because it is close and inexpensive. We usually get a couple of drinks and free chips and salsa to start. Make sure to ask for the chips and salsa because they won't just bring them to you. I wish this Chili's had a bigger beer selection. They used to have Stone on tap but got rid of it for some reason. :/ I will usually get a presidente margarita (only $5 during HH) or a Fat Tire. Then, we usually split a meal or get the 2 for $20 deal if we are extra hungry. I recommend the margarita lime chicken or the Cajun chicken pasta. Mmmm!

Usually never had a problem with this chilis but tonight just did it for me. First we came in as there was 1 couple and 1 family waiting ahead of us which was fine obviously, as the time went one of the hostesses informed us that there was an open booth by the bar, we got up and it was really awkward when she just stood there and didn't seat us meanwhile we were confused as to where she wanted us to go. Then her friends or maybe those people worked here? Walked right in as I asked her a question and she completely ignored me and talked to her friends and they walked in and took our seat. She then looked as us and told us to there was another open booth, again not guiding us to where but pointing without our menus as we walked to the booth it was not clean from the past customer. Confused again we waited and she told us once again "oh there's that other open booth around the corner you can have I'll have someone clean it up"... okay? After the other girl was done cleaning she again told us to go to that table, meanwhile I had to ask our waitress for menus. Loved this chilis and the food but Damn hostesses you have one job and that girl who was working tonight couldn't do it and was r.u.d.e

Since when were children allowed to sit at the bar? Came in for lunch/watch football and very disappointing and annoying to have some 3/4 yr old kicking my chair and screaming in my ear the whole time.

My boyfriend and I had dinner here the other night and had Josh as our bartender and server and let me tell you, this guy is amazing!! He told us about some good meals he personally enjoys and my bf ended up ordering one which was fantastic. I believe it was mesquite chicken off the guiltless menu or something. Anyways, Josh was so friendly and personable, we loved him! Also turned us onto Kettle One as well (he knew his vodkas). Thanks Josh!

Use to be regulars but the last two times received poor service and now we won't return.  Server brought out appetizer and then never brought out meal when we reminded her she brought out cold food.  Second time again server forgot many things and then overcharged us

I was sitting waiting at the Chili's reading everyone's Yelps and was suprised to see the negatives here. We were seated in 15 minutes on a really busy night and our server was really nice and cheery for it being super crowded. Another reviewer mentioned the closeness of the tables that bothered them, and while we were not sitting at that section I could see the issue watching people filling in and out of them. The noise voulme was still low enough to hear conversation at our table without having to shout, so to the other reviews I am not sure what noise they were talking about, maybe the bar? The food was just as good as any other Chili's I have been to and it was brought out in roughly 15 minutes. The server was really good at refilling drinks when they were around 75% empty without even having to ask.  Every restaraunt has good visits and bad, and I have to say, while it was super busy, our experience was great and I will be back again.

Man, everytime we come here the cooks screw up the order.   They cannot cook a steak here.  Medium rare = Tartar or well done, depending on the cook.  You can see the frustration in the waitstaff's faces.  The manager stepped up and apologized for the three times that we had to send the steaks back - the meal was on the house.

I feel like this Chili's does not meet up to its standards.  I've been to quite a few Chili's restaurants and I feel this is the worst one I've been to. So that tells me it's the management.   The serving is pretty much garbage. I would give the waitresses 0 stars.  The only reason why I gave this place 2 stars is the food is decent.  But the 2 times I been to this chili's (the second time on accident because it was so long since we went I spaced out how much I hated going to this place) it took 2-3 minutes for anybody to meet us at the door and sit us. (Both times for lunch when it was very very slow) So it takes maybe 6-8 minutes for a less than busy waitress to take our drink order and then I realize again how much I hate this place.  Do they have good drinks, maybe.  Good food, yeah it's decent but the service is garbage.   I would save my time and money and go to Applebees down the street.  I would ALWAYS choose Chili's before Appplebee's but this Chili's is not my favorite place.

Great happy hour in the bar. Free chips n salsa are always a plus! When you sit at the bar the bartenders are on top of things and very friendly. I know they work for tips and its not usually sincere but they do a great job at making you feel welcome!

I have been going to this chillis since I was a sophomore in high school. The service is always amazing and I couldn't be happier with the food and drinks. The restaurant is always clean. And the staff is always friendly.
Family fun at Chili's, standard restaurant fare for a chain.  Good service, good food, clean restrooms, what else can you ask for?

I ALWAYS use to push to go to Chili's as I am a sucker for their a) salsa, and b) chicken club tacos.  This last time will be my last time 1)took FOR-EVER to get a waiter to get our drink order (I have 2 toddlers...had I known it was going to take over 15 min for drinks I would have just brought them some!) 2) I *heart* their salsa, but I had to take the time to brush the LOADS of salt off of each chip before I could eat them....so a little of the magic is gone. 3) I ordered the chicken club tacos (which come with mexican rice and black beans), and there were no beans. When I mentioned this I was told that those were "extra". 4) The tacos had none of the mexi-ranch sauce (typically it does and they include a side container of it), the waitress seemed annoyed that I kept asking for things. 5) When I finally started to eat them I realized that not only were they cold, the chicken was so overcooked that it couldn't be chewed.   Now normally this would just irk me with the kitchen and not the waitstaff (it's not their fault right?), but when I pointed it out to her, her expression was one of " So? what do you want ME to do?" She did finally offer to take it back to the kitchen but by this point my husband and children were finished and ready to go.  (Shame we had to leave CHILI'S and get mom something to eat at the nearby Burger King :( When I asked to speak to a manager she said she would get one.....15-20 min later nothing.  VERY disappointed, as I am usually the one in my family pulling to go there.

Went to Chili's for a friends birthday tonight. The server was cranky and rude. And the burger I ordered was really overcooked, dried out and cold. My stomach started cramping up as soon as we left and as soon as I got home the whole meal decided to eject itself from my gut, and no I wasn't drinking. Lol! After reading the other reviews I can see that I'm not alone in how I feel. The management is obviously inept.

Sounds silly, but Dan was the man! he indulged us in our silly convo that we trapped him in, he got us happy our specials on our supper yummy margaritas(when it wasnt happy hour!), and was just an all around great server!  Soooo, Chilis is Chilis... we have all been there before so it kinda depends on the wait staff you have for the most part. every time we have been here they have been spot on the dime. if Chilis is what the belly is craving then this is the one to hit up. Ask for Dan when you are being seated and you are pretty much guaranteed a swell time! if that isnt doing it for you a couple of their awesome Presidente Margaritas oughta help :p

Met up with a group of female friends for happy hour. It happened to be a busy evening, especially on a Tuesday night. Not sure why it was so busy, maybe due to Spring Break. There were seven in our group, including myself. As we waited at the bar area for our table, a couple of tables at the bar cleared up. We asked if we can just stay in the bar area instead of their dining area. We were able to transfer from the small booth to a couple of tables put together. Our server was nice and friendly, also a little overwhelmed. I couldn't decide what I wanted to eat and I didn't really want to drink, since I had to drive home, which was approx 40-45 min. Southeast of Oceanside. As my friends ordered their food and drinks, our server got caught up with their jokes and antics, she forgot to take my food order. As everybody else got their food, I was still waiting for our server to return. She finally took my order and apologized for forgetting. I know I was one of the quiet ones in our group. I usually am quiet when it comes new friends that I'm still trying to get to know. I ended up ordering the Triple Dipper appetizer. I got the Big Mouth Bites, Boneless Honey-Chipotle Wings and Southwestern Eggrolls. The Southwestern Eggrolls are my favorite! Since I didn't have any alcohol, I ordered a Mango Iced Tea. While my friends were downing their margaritas after they finished eating, I was still finishing up my food. As we received our somewhat separate checks, our server managed to mix up the checks. She had to correct a few of them. Overall, it was a fun evening spent with great company.

Food was acceptable I was really hungry. I was pretty shocked to hear the first words out of our waitress mouth was about alcoholic drinks when my wife if 5 months pregnant and while I have my daughter with me. Better selection on choices would have been perfect.

Great Service. Chilis had that promotional "Veterans and Active Duty eat free" for Veteran's Day, so my husband (Marine) and I decided to go treat ourselves and our daughter since we had such HORRIBLE SERVICE AT IHOP in the morning.  There was a lot of people there!  The wait was about 45 minutes to an hour for everyone.  So we decided to wait.  We saw a couple of my husband's friends there so he got a drink for the bar and we chilled for a bit.   The hostesses were very on top of things and professional.  All the workers seemed very quick, like they have been preparing for today.  We got seated and our server came seconds later to greet us and get us drinks.  We ordered the free meal as well as the 2 for $20 promotion they had going on.  I know a lot of food for just us and our infant, but we were going to take some home anyways.  The appetizers came quick!  So we were satisfied til the entrees came out.  They served it to us right after we finished our appetizer.  So we decided to order a lava flow too, just because.  The meal was great and we took the rest home.  Gave a good tip and left very happy. A good way to end Veteran's Day for our Marine Family :)
Love this Restaurant, but loved the service here more than other Chiis true customer satisfaction!

I come here all the time; 3x in the last 30 days or so. The margaritas are pretty good and the salmon is OK, but the Caribbean salad is my favorite. The staff is always really friendly, and they have never messed up my order. Today, we came here with our 3 week old baby and the staff was extra attentive and accommodating. Really, the only bad thing I can think of is that I always try to order sweet potato on the side but they never have it. Adjacent to Chili's is Macaroni Grill, Outback Steakhouse, The Q, and El Torito - and out of all five my wife and I prefer Chili's.

Went last night. Hostess was friendly but asked us to wait 10 minutes although it was only 5:20 and the place was less than half full. Once seated, we didn't meet our server for another 18 minutes. She couldn't have failed to see us because she was busy with a woman and six kids. When finally came over, she claimed that the hostess didn't tell her that we were there. I ordered a strawberry margarita which was an awful syrupy mess. The hamburgers were very good but mine was missing the BBQ sauce that was supposed to be on it. Took our server long enough to return with it and my husband was halfway through his meal. The table across from us where the  woman with the six kids sat was left uncleaned during our meal and we and the other diners had to look at unturned classes, napkins, leftover food all over the table and floor. We probably won't return.

I only go to the bar, so that's what I'm commenting on. The food is OK, but way overpriced. I was upset that they could not turn the volume on one of the TVs during the NBA playoffs--the manager explained that was only for certain occasions. But at happy hour, the bar is decent, with friendly bartenders and ok prices on drinks. The lesson: go during happy hour only.

I had the best waitress when I went the other day her name was Aurora. Her name fits her perfectly, such a proffesional girl, and beautiful inside and out as well. She took good care of my husband and I, we were visiting from Orange County and she made our restaraunt experience a pleasure. Next time my husband and I come down were are going to Chili's and hope we can get Aurora again as a server.
Food is what you would expect from a major chain restaurant. I am giving them 3 stars because I do take out a lot and every single time the mess up my order. Every. Single. Time.

Well, after watching a tv show about Chili's bBy back ribs, my bf and I decided to go try Chili's again.  It had been a few years since the last time.  It was quite busy, being a Friday nite, so we thot it would be a good meal.  I ordered the 1/2 slab which comes with fries and my bf ordered the chicken fried steak, which comes with mashedpotatoes, corn on the cob and garlic bread.  It was a good portion and the steak was fried nice and crisp, the gravy was thick, and overall better than most.  The ribs were average at best.  They looked better than they tasted and there wasn't much meat as there was only about a big bite of meat between ribs.  This will be the last time i'd order ribs here as there are many alternatives for BBQ in SD.  The appetizer of onion strings and jalapenos were ok, not too greasy, and a generous portion for the price.  Service was a bit slow, but they were quite busy.  This should satisfy our visit here for a few more years!

So, the waitstaff works in pairs.  That would be great except the 2nd person would never make eye contact with us.  Philly cheesesteak sliders came out as steak sliders and we couldn't get anyone's attention to even correct it.  Not enough tortillas with the fajitas and couldn't get anyone's attention to correct that, either.  Didn't see anyone from the time the food was delivered until the table was ready to be cleared.  They did take some off the bill, but not sure a revisit is worth the aggravation.
Delicious Food, Gr8 Service, Friendly Staff, Gr8 Drinks, Wow, So Much Fun....

This Chili's location is the best! The service is awesome- I always get a smile as soon as I walk in the door and by the time I  leave, I have a smile on my face, too. They've recently changed their happy hour which used to be not great, but now is much better. I love the Chambord margarita- my server one night recommended getting it with sugar instead of the salt like most margaritas get and I loved it and will be getting it that way next time I go in. My husband always gets either the quesadilla salad or the carne asada steak. Even though this is a corporate place, I will only eat at this location because when I've eaten at other Chili's they never seem to get my order right, but here it is always great.

The best!  Love it!  Love it! Every time!  The food is awesome, the service great.  Always my favorite! IMO, the best in the West! :(((  We go ther once a week, and know exactly what to expect.  I don't know what 's going on, but things are going down.  My favorite salad of all times is now about 1/2 the size it used to be, fries always always come out hard and cold, ribs are dried out, and the other day the waitress had the gull to tell me that it is what it is!  Now service sucks too!  What happened?  I was at Chilis in Escondido the other day, everything came out perfectly.  You guys in Oceanside, get a grip. You're loosing me.

Service is always hit or miss at the Vista Way location in Vista. Half the staff always seems cranky and rude which makes for bad service. I tend to request certain people if I see them working because I know they always give great service. The food here is also hit or miss unfortunately. I usually stick with the chicken fajitas because 99% of the time they come out great. Everything else I have ordered here is always 50/50 on quality and taste. I have had issues sending food back because it was just unedible. Again depending on the service though this either goes smoothly or is a train wreck. The bad servers are always like really your sending it back are you sure you can't just eat it. Which is upsetting. Because of the service and food at this location being so hit or miss all the time a went from going here once a week to maybe once every two months or so now. Usually the only reason I go to this location now is because it's late and I had a long day don't want to cook and it's close by. I prefer the location in Oceanside. The Oceanside location is up to par 99% of the time.

ate here with a friend just to catch up. food was good our waitress was awesome! somehow i feel that makes the food taste better or at least more enjoyable. poor girl was busy yet still had time to stop by and smile.

One of our family favorites. It's nothing out of this world.  Just a very well-rounded restaurant.  Sometimes you'll have to wait during the busy hours of 6pm - 7pm.  They have a number options in all categories.  From chicken to steak to salad to burgers to appetizers.  Prices are pretty reasonable and service is always good. Again, nothing too special about it but I have to say it's consistency is the best thing because you always know what to expect.
I dont really care for chilis.....This is for HAPPY HOUR. Great prices and drinks. Free chips and salsa....the Tropical margarita is delicious! i loved it.

So i went into chili's for happy hour, 3-6pm i entered and was seated at 2:49 pm, pondered over my menu for about 15-20 mins as the waiter brought us waters.  I then order the "free" chips and salsa, that is supposed to be free during happy hour....and said i still needed more time to look at the menu. When he arrived with the chips, i told him id have the 8 nachos, seriously they give you 8 chips that's it.... I ate my nachos and chips drank my water and was ready for my bill...i waited and waited for the bill finally giving up and walking to the employees only area and asking my waiter for the check... got my check and he charged me for the chips and salsa, so i reminded him they were free during happy hour and it was 3:40....he told me since we walked in and sat down at 2:49 that we were not eligible for the happy hour specials!!!!! we didnt order until after 3!!!! Is customer service dead and gone?

I have come here 4 times to eat dinner. i enjoy drinking an old fashioned but each time I'm told by ours servers that the bar has run out of bitters. this is ridiculous. its not a difficult drink to make and bar not having bitters makes no sense.

I ate here with my gf last night and the service was a bit slow, the food was just good, but it's something else that made me appreciate this restaurant and it's staff. I had gone to the restroom before the food came and when I came back I took 2 rings off my hand so I could get my hands completely dry after washing them. I must've set the rings on the table and forgotten them once we paid and left because when I woke up this morning I realized they were gone and couldn't find them anywhere around my house. After work today I decided to stop by Chili's just hoping that someone had found them and put them aside safely in a lost and found. I really didn't think I was going to get them back, figured a busboy had just pocketed them when he found them or something, but to my surprise the hostess at the front desk came out from the back of the restaurant with both my rings in her hand and a smile on her face. I seriously couldn't believe it. Someone could've easily come up on over $300 in nice jewelery but instead whoever it was that found that was honest and turned them into a manager who placed them in the lost and found area. So despite the mediocre food and service, at least their staff has integrity and can be trusted with their patrons personal items. I'm going to chalk up the slow service and room temperature food to a bad night in the kitchen this time and I'll definitely be coming back to give them another shot based on their honesty alone. Thank you everyone at this Chili's for being so awesome! Really made my day when I thought I was done for.

Our waitress was amazing! She constantly checked on us & gave us everything we asked for. It took 20 minutes for them to realize we were sitting at a table, when they did the manager came & apologized for the wait & said we sat ourselves which was a lie. But the food was disgusting. Do not eat here ever!

I probably eat here at least twice a month.  I rarely eat at a corportate establishment.  This Chili's is the exception.  Every time the food is great!  Comes out hot, quick and exactly as ordered ( usually some modification.)  Tonight we share a burger, perfect... fires hot, seasoned and plentyful, they even split the plate for us.  Bonless chix wings were fantastic.  And it's happy hour until close I believe... WOW !   I am so impressed with this Chili's!

I give 5 stars not just becauser this is where my girlfriend and i met but  nothing is ever premade you can order things however you want and it will come out fresh hot and delicious.  i shouldn't really have to explain about chilis becasue its a chain so i will; just say this place has great cheerfull service wonderful chips and salsa and the best veggie fajitas around i love it and everyone should jump on the chilis train
Good service, great food and THE BEST PRESIDENTES. If you crave a margarita? The Presidente margarita at Chilis is the best in town.
The service I have had here has been very good. Although, I've gotten a couple of my entrees when they were nearly cold. At times, there are plenty of single attractive gals here that like to party.

The food was ok but the service was terrible. We arrived at 11am right when they opened and were the third couple there and they actually made us sit for 10 minutes and wait because for some reason ALL of there waitresses were late to work on a Sunday. If you want fast service dont eat here

I would have given it two stars but our server was amazing. She was sweet and attentive and made our experience so pleasant. Chili's is one of those restaurants that I find to be the definition of mediocre. They're barely good and I only wind up at one when cheap meals are needed. (say for someone's birthday). Our table was TERRIBLE. Half of it was taken up by two ketchup bottles (one was basically empty), the "specials" paper display, and a light that jutted out from the wall at shoulder level to illuminate our plates. We were packed in so tight to the other tables that when someone bent over to buss the one next to us if he had backed up even a step his butt would have been on my plate. The two for twenty is not only money saving it is flexible, yummy, and worth every penny. If you are sick order to go soup on-line and pick it up. The southwestern soup will clear those sinuses!

This is another one of those places I try to avoid when suggested. It's ok if you just want a quick meal but I've had good and bad experiences there. I've had to send food back twice because the sandwich I ordered was put in a basket that was soaking wet. They got me another sandwich and basket was wet again! Yea, that pretty much turned me off to that place. Other times I have been back were better. Prices are decent for the food. The place is almost always crowded and chances are you will always see people waiting to be seated. I think it has to do with the location and maybe some people actually find it to be a nice place to hang out.

Chili's was one of my favorite places to go- not anymore

Some of the reviews here baffle me. They talk about an overall decent experience, yet give only two stars. Harsh! I hope they don't treat their kids the same way.  My partner and I are regulars here and we often go for dinner after work, about once a week. For the absolute best service, sit in the bar area. The servers there are dynamite! Fast, friendly, efficient, responsive, explosive... just kidding about that last one. :-) The rest is true though, they truly work towards making sure your experience is a positive one. The other part of the dining area... well, I'll get to that later. Overall their menu consists of fairly flavorful food. The fried shrimp is as close to perfect as I've ever found: lightly battered, full of flavor, and perfectly cooked. I can't tell you how many time I've been disappointed by fried shrimp in other places. The batter is too thick, the shrimp is too salty, or they overcook it. Here it's good almost every time. I don't usually eat red meat, but I'll sometimes make an exception for their babyback ribs. Both the original and the Shiner Bock sauces are good. The Monterey Chicken is another flavorful favorite. Some of the items, such as the Margarita Chicken, leave something to be desired with dry chicken. That particular item is healthier fare though, with no gravy or cheese to tone down the dryness of the chicken breast. When you go as many times as I have, you learn what to consistently order and what to avoid. Still, if it's still on the menu, then there must be those who like it, right? For margarita lovers, it's hard to beat El Presidente! Just the right amount of tartness, sweetness and kick. Other places may make decent margaritas, but these remain an absolute favorite. I love dessert, but most of the desserts here I find to be way too sweet. Sugar overload, especially with either of the lava cakes. While I have mostly positive things to say about this Chili's, there are a few things that cause me to remove a star from a potential 5-star rating. Before we learned to sit in the bar, we would sit in the regular dining area. One of the Happy Hour specials is $5 margaritas. Well if you sit in the regular dining area, you won't get happy hour prices. Occasionally a server will honor the happy hour price, but usually they'll just tell you those prices are only available in the bar. Is that ridiculous or what? So I would tell the server forget it, haul myself over to the bar, get the margarita, and then go back to my seat. Seriously, what is the big deal where we sit? Happy hour prices should be everywhere! The full menu is available in the bar, so what's the difference? Another area of disappointment is inconsistency. First the inconsistency of service regarding the dining area drink prices. Second is sometimes the margarita is off - either it's too watered down, or it's not filled to the top of the shaker. They seem to have improved that in the last few weeks, so maybe they got rid of the bad bartender. Or maybe they make better ones because we sit in the bar now. Who knows. It's true there tend to be hoards of screaming children around every time we go, but it's one of the downfalls of going to a family friendly place. It's noticeably better in the bar area, for obvious reasons (though they don't ban kids from sitting there if they're with parents). Yet another reason to sit in the bar during happy hour!  The noise levels are average for a busy restaurant. A bit loud, depending on who your table neighbors are, but you should be able to hear your table-mates' conversations. Overall a great place to go with friends or family.

I really enjoy going to this Chilis. I always receive good service and the food is always good. The parking can get kind of annoying due to all stores and other restaurants in the vicinity. I order takeout online a lot so I highly recommend it as they always get my order correct. Happy hour has some great deals, I recommend trying the margaritas, they're my favorite. My only complaint is when I get sat by customers with noisy children (which sadly has been 75% of the time)... You know the rest.

I have gone here on quite a few date nights with my husband as well as gone for other times for lunches and dinner and I do enjoy the food. The noise level is nicer at lunch time thn dinner because a lot more people go in for dinner so it gets pretty noisy.  But the service has always been great and the food is quite good so I will continue to go here once in a while.
it is hit or miss... and tonite it was definitely a miss.Mediocre food, bad service and a long wait.

It's Chili's what do you expect? I go mostly for their Happy Hour as you get free chips and salsa and their drinks are pretty decently priced. Nonetheless its decent for a happy hour and even then you can find a better place if you feel like researching happy hours.

Chili's used to be good, but the past couple of years it has really gone downhill.  Service is pretty awful.  Food is usually cold and not prepared right.  Not sure what's changed but it's just not the same.
